history.content:
I have some questions about withdrawing or cancelling Spring 2021. I also emailed my ESS advisor and contacted the financial aid office. But for the sake of urgency I'd like to ask here in case someone can answer.

Essentially, Fall 2020 was really rough for me academically and for my mental health. I could really use a break to focus on my mental health and personal development. I'd like to withdraw or cancel Spring 2021 and readmit for Fall 2021.

  1. First, I want to make sure this plan is even feasible. When I was admitted to Berkeley, I was told that I would have 5 semesters to complete my degree and so far I have attended 3 semesters. If I withdrew/cancelled Spring 2021 would I still be able to attend both Fall 2021 and Spring 2022?

  2. I understand that in order to continue classes I will have to apply for readmission. I've heard this process is straightforward, however I'd like to know how it would affect my enrollment for Fall 2021. Would I be able to register for classes at the same time I normally would or would my enrollment time be delayed?

  3. I'd also like to ask how this could affect summer internships. Right now I don't have an internship lined up for the summer, but hopefully I will. Obviously it will be up to the employer whether they care. However, does anyone have any general knowledge or experience about how internships are affected by a Spring withdrawal? Does the school make a conscious attempt to notify employers about students current enrollment status?

  4. I've been receiving the Federal Pell Grant and Cal Grant B. Should I expect that by not attending Spring 2021 that my financial aid for the 2021-2022 year will be affected?

  5. According to this page, if I withdraw on the first day of instruction (tomorrow) then I will be refunded all fees except for late fees, health insurance, class pass, and document management. Is my interpretation of this correct?
history.subject: Questions about withdrawal/cancellation for Spring 2021
